tabfields.helpertext: Important: The Information if a user as seen the banner is stored in cookie which is not resetted, when deactivating this plugin. If you want to reset user settings you can rename the cookie name.
tabfields.name: Enable Cookie Banner

tabfields.helpertext: If checked you see the banner in the settings section and your consent cookie will be deleted with every admin page view. So you can see the banner more often in the frontend.
tabfields.name: Preview Banner

tabfields.helpertext: If checked, the events 'beautiful_cookie_consent_initialized' and 'beautiful_cookie_consent_updated' will pushed in your dataLayer after consent or a change of consent. See documentation how to use them.
tabfields.name: Push consent event to dataLayer

tabfields.helpertext: Caution: only change if you know what you are doing. If you have renamed your default GTM dataLayer you can put the new name here. To this dataLayer the event will pushed.
tabfields.name: DataLayer name

tabfields.helpertext: In most browser cookies set by javascript are only valid for a short period of time. Without this setting your user will see the banner after that time again, which can be annoying. By checking this option, the cookie is converted to a backend cookie and the defined expiration is restored. Default expiration is 365 days.
tabfields.name: Prevent premature cookie deletion (use backend cookie)

tabfields.helpertext: If you check this the banner loads on 'DOMContentLoaded' instead of 'load'. Test properly! In some Installations this might break the banner.
tabfields.name: Improve Banner loading speed

tabfields.helpertext: You can show an additional 'x' to close the banner. Depending on the compliance type the cookie value will be: allow, deny or savesettings
tabfields.name: Show x to close banner

tabfields.helpertext: Per default it is an 'x'. Here you can change this to anything you like.
tabfields.name: Text for close 'x'

tabfields.helpertext: Default the banner is appended to document.body. If you want to append it somewhere else you can use query selector here. If you want to append it to the footer tag just type in 'footer' or to use an element with an certain id: [id='page'].
tabfields.name: Position in HTML of page (querySelector)

tabfields.helpertext: Add you desired Fonts name here, e.g. 'Catamaran-Regular', sans-serif. Please be aware that these fonts should be loaded already. You can only use already existing fonts here. It won't install them.
tabfields.name: Custom font name

tabfields.pre_selected_value: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.
tabfields.name: Text for Banner

selectable_values.name: Just tell the user we use cookies.

tabfields.helpertext: If you use 'Differentiated Consent', 'Opt-in' or 'Opt-out' you must make sure, that all plugins and features of your site respect that setting. More info see documentation. The user settings can be read from the cookie set by this plugin or the dataLayer.
tabfields.name: Compliance Type

tabfields.helpertext: Specify the different cookie types. Cookie Suffix: each cookie type gets an own cookie to save the acceptance status. The name is '<cookiename>'_'cookie suffix'.
tabfields.name: Cookie Types

tabfields.helpertext: Per default the button which sets the highest consent is highlighted, this can be considered as dark pattern. For some regulations it is neccesary, that both have an equal weight. When ticking this box, they have same size and color.
tabfields.name: Make the buttons look equal

tabfields.helpertext: Only for 'Differentiated Consent': It might be useful to have the configured default setting on first page view in a cookie, before any user interaction. Depending on your compliance requirements, it might be a legal issue.
tabfields.name: Set cookies with default values on 1st page view

tabfields.helpertext: To disable, leave empty. To enable, set to the number of pixels a user must scroll vertically in order to trigger the dismiss.
tabfields.name: Allow on scroll

tabfields.helpertext: To disable, leave empty. To enable set value as time in milliseconds to autodismiss after set time.
tabfields.name: Allow on timeout (ms)

tabfields.helpertext: Not working in admin preview! Only in frontend. Depending on your tracking set up, you might need a reload of the page after an opt in to track the page on which the user opted in. Useful when auto block is enabled, too.
tabfields.name: Reload after Bannerclick

tabfields.helpertext: If checked and the user declines the usage of cookies, the banner will be shown on the next page load again, until he accepts. In case of 'Differentiated consent' the user must accept all cookie types.
tabfields.name: Ask until acceptance

tabfields.helpertext: Activate this, to block the page content, until the banner is closed. You force the user to make a choice.
tabfields.name: Block Page, if Banner shown

tabfields.helpertext: Disable the banner, if the page is loaded in an iFrame.
tabfields.name: Disable in iFrames

tabfields.helpertext: Show tab at the bottom to give users the possibilty to change cookie settings.
tabfields.name: Show 'Cookie Settings' tab

tabfields.helpertext: Text of the small tab at the botton, once user had made a cookie choice.
tabfields.name: Text for 'Cookie Settings' tab

tabfields.helpertext: Text for link for showing the banner again. Nice to give user ability to manage their settings without displaying the 'Cookie Settings' tab. To display the link use this shortcode: [cc_show_cookie_banner_nsc_bar]
tabfields.name: Shortcode: Link text 'show banner'

tabfields.name: Shortcode: Link text 'opted in'

tabfields.name: Shortcode: Link text 'opted out'

tabfields.helpertext: To enable this feature get the premium add-on from https://beautiful-cookie-banner.com/ and support the development of this plugin.
tabfields.name: Enable Service Blocking (beta)

tabfields.helpertext: Be careful: changing the name will cause the banner to show up for all users again. The settings get 'resetted'.
tabfields.name: Cookie Name

tabfields.helpertext: You can leave it empty. If you do so, the current domain where the banner is clicked is used as cookie domain. Be careful: if changing the domain all users will see the banner again, because their cookie gets 'resetted'.
tabfields.name: Cookie Domain
